de.topicmapslab.tmql4j.components.processor.runtime.module
Class PrefixHandler

java.lang.Object
  de.topicmapslab.tmql4j.components.processor.runtime.module.PrefixHandler

public class PrefixHandler
extends java.lang.Object

Class representing the prefix handler to add and read the defined prefixes of the current runtime

Author:
Sven Krosse

Method Detail

registerPrefix

public void registerPrefix(java.lang.String prefix,
                           java.lang.String uri)
Register a new prefix definition in the TMQL engine. Please note that only registered prefixes can used in context of a TMQL query.

Parameters:
prefix - the prefix
uri - the absolute IRI

getPrefix

public java.lang.String getPrefix(java.lang.String prefix)
Method return the IRI of the given identifier.

Parameters:
prefix - the identifier of the prefix
Returns:
the stored prefix or null if the identifiers is unknown

getPrefixMap

public java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> getPrefixMap()
method returns all registered prefixes as mapping between prefix and absolute IRI.

Returns:
the prefix map

isKnownSystemIdentifier

public boolean isKnownSystemIdentifier(java.lang.String token)
Method checks if the given token represents a TMDM specified IRI, like tm:name or tm:subject.

Parameters:
token - the token to check
Returns:
true if the token is a TMDM specified IRI, false otherwise.

getAbsoluteSystemIdentifier

public java.lang.String getAbsoluteSystemIdentifier(java.lang.String token)
Method returns the absolute IRI of the given relative system identifier.

Parameters:
token - the relative IRI
Returns:
the corresponding absolute IRI

getDefaultPrefix

public java.lang.String getDefaultPrefix()
Returns the stored default prefix

Returns:
the default prefix

setDefaultPrefix

public void setDefaultPrefix(java.lang.String defaultPrefix)
Changes the stored default prefix

Parameters:
defaultPrefix - the default prefix

isKnownPrefix

public boolean isKnownPrefix(java.lang.String prefix)
Method checks if the given prefix is known by the handler.

Parameters:
prefix - the prefix to check
Returns:
true if the prefix is known, false otherwise.

toAbsoluteIRI

public java.lang.String toAbsoluteIRI(java.lang.String reference)
                               throws TMQLRuntimeException
Transform the given relative to its absolute IRI reference. If the given reference is already an absolute IRI, it will be returned unmodified. If the prefix is unknown, an exception will be thrown.

Parameters:
reference - the reference
Returns:
the absolute IRI
Throws:
TMQLRuntimeException - thrown if the prefix is unknown
